column4: I suggest you use gparted to resize your ubuntu partition and make room for an xp (or whatever windows) install with a large area of unallocated space

thanks i think i will just go with what green91, and others said its easier to install windows first after a wipe of entire system then install ubuntu 11.04 back again, thanks that way grub will have control instead of me messing around with resizing and other things that i might not be skilled at to fix if broken
You can chmod it back to the original permissions but there is no 'undo'
can i just delete the executable and that can take care of the plugin
its just a plugin that lets me bypass megavideo limit but now i dont want it anymore
in grub it would be hd(0,0) I think
that first line is the kernel
the first line with /boot up to quiet splash vt.handoff=7
